"The Bill Clinton 's speech last night was potentially seismic for him," said Richard Greene , a communications strategist who has written on history's most unforgettable speeches. Every time the Bill Clinton shows himself in this very warm, very human light, a light that everyone can relate to, he softens up the argument against his agenda. Barack Obama 's entrance into the drama came as the harsh partisan rhetoric was escalating. Some liberals, such as Sen. Bernie Sanders of Vermont, said vitriolic language from conservatives had helped to create a hateful atmosphere.

Asked whether he planned to stay another four years at Google to collect stock awards worth$ 100 million, Eric Schmidt said: Yes, that is my plan. Google said last month co-founder Larry Page would take over as chief executive from April 4 while Eric Schmidt would assume the role of executive chairman.

Education secretary Michael Gove talking to pupils at the Cuckoo Hall primary school in Edmonton, north London, where he announced plans to raise school standards in May last year. Photograph: John Stillwell/PA Now, what I want is Facts. Teach these boys and girls nothing but Facts. Facts alone are wanted in life. Plant nothing else and root out everything else. You can only form the minds of reasoning animals upon Facts. Nothing else will ever be of service to them... Stick to Facts, sir!
